_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Overview:  



The Plaze Georgia facility, located at 310 Brookhollow Industrial Blvd, Dalton Georgia, (PLZ-GA) is operated as a contract aerosol manufacturing facility. PLZ-GA manufactures various organic and water based solvent cleaners and pesticides as janitorial aerosol products. The primary AST storage material and transfer operations takes place in a central portion of the facility with storm water discharges also leaving this area to the south. The facility operates 8  propellant tanks with tanks used for propane blends including: one 18,000 gallon tank for NP-70, nne 12,000 gallon tank for NP-85, one 18,000 gallon tank for NP-46, one 9,000 gallon tank for A-108; one 18,000 gallon tank for 152a; one 5,500 gallon tank for NP-31; one 5,500 gallon tank for DME; and a single 30,000 gallon tank for CO2. These tanks are located in the central courtyard on the northeast side of the production plant.  Production chemicals are stored in drums or totes and also within the ASTs. Finished products are stocked in the warehouse areas and shipped off-property through the loading dock area adjacent to the warehouse. Liquid process chemical deliveries are made directly to the tank farm via tanker truck to permanent piping systems.



Emergency Response Plan:  



Our written Emergency Response plan is written in accordance with Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Regulations 29 CFR 1910.38.  The purpose of the plan is to ensure the protection of our employees in an emergency situation (fire, tornado, chemical spill, or other emergency).  We do not maintain a fire brigade, but do maintain fire response equipment such as hand held fire extinguishers for small fires.  The plan includes procedures for notification of the local emergency authorities.  In the event of an emergency involving our propane system, it is our policy to notify the Dalton Fire Department and request that they help respond to the emergency. We have coordinated our resp

onse plans (RCRA Contingency Plan and Emergency Action Plan) with the fire department; members of the fire department have inspected our propane system and conducted a joint exercise with us in past annual emergency evacuation tests.



Prevention Program:  



The facility has a prevention program in place that complies with NFPA 58 requirements for LP Gas storage and the EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule.  Employees have been trained of the procedures associated with the processes and the Emergency Action Plan, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local regulations.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Dalton Fire Department and any potentially affected neighbors. 



5-Year Accident History:  



The facility has had no accidents related to this process in the last 5 years.



Planned changes to improve safety: 



Continue to reinforce safe practices during operational training and safety training meetings.
